text:
Hello everyone!
I would like to know if there is a way for the components created in React to appear in the “Theme Modules” section.
In your meta you can configure `categories` to be theme it should work

Thanks for your reply but I must be doing something wrong because it doesn't work. I have the following:
meta code
```export const meta = {
  label: '[Global] 000 footer',
  host_template_types: ['PAGE'],
  categories: ['pro-websites-theme'],
};```
The theme is inside a folder with the name: `pro-websites-theme`
and in the folder I have:

Hello <@U066BM0FLH0>, we have <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react/blob/4fca49aca65e36b4d121b5f09404ddbf6a2c4e3a/docs/reference/cms-components.md?plain=1#L59|this hook>. Here is <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react/blob/4fca49aca65e36b4d121b5f09404ddbf6a2c4e3a/examples/styling/styling-project/styling-app/components/StyledJSXRegistry.jsx#L2|example> usage.
Oh! Great! Works! Thank so much! :smile:
is there any way of creating new categories?
Just an update again — we found some bugs in how our backend surfaces logs to the UI and updated those. More logs should be coming through now, FWIW.

What would have the biggest impact on build time? Removing unused module or removing unused npm packages? How about the biggest impact on file size?

Seems like removing unused modules will have the biggest impact on my tailwind partial so I'll start there but it would be interesting to know the inner-workings

Hey everyone. Just checking if someone could help with this one.
I'm trying to import a partial into a module using:
```{% js_partial
          path="@projects/inntopia-project/react-app/components/partials/RentalsClient.tsx"
          supplierID="11418161"
        %}```
In the console I can see all a bunch of warning like:
```[Report Only] Refused to load the script '<https://mtbuller-dev-diego.staging.iddigital.com.au/hs/hsstatic/cos-i18n/static-1.53/bundles/project.js>' because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "script-src 'none'". Note that 'script-src-elem' was not explicitly set, so 'script-src' is used as a fallback.```
I can see the UI of the module but the javascript/react is not working
